Summary: Bright red light appeared out of nowhere, increased in brightness, it was over the lake (lake travis), shortly after focusing binoculars it disappeared completely
trends: There have been 188 other sightings in Austin
There were no other sightings in Austin on or around July 25th 2009
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsmy brother, a friend, and i were on our deck in lakeway texas. we were having a casual conversation when the ufo appeared. i was staring off into the horizon, facing nw, just staring at the lake and stars. all of a sudden, (and i mean out of nowhere) there suddenly appeared a very bright red light. i shouted, "what is that?" my brother and friend turned and saw the bright red light, we briefly inquired amongst ourselves whether or not it was a flare. james, my brother, grabbed a pair of (8x42)bushnell excursions binoculars, (we keep a pair on the deck to bird watch etc.)he quickly got them focused. my friend and i sat amazed, commenting that there was no sound at all, we also agreed it increased in brightness. james was quickly able to determine that the bright red light (spherical or circular, as viewed from the deck) when focused in the binoculars was definitely an object with lights, he explained a red one and a smaller purple-ish\white. all the while we are quickly analyzing possible explanations in our heads. he hands the binoculars to me and i get the object focused and clearly there was a definitive object, with lights helping to define its features. the lights appeared as a bright red and in my opinion a smaller white\yellow one, possibly two, i yelled to him to grab the camera and in that instant it blinked out, it "turned-off." it was there and then gone. before we got overly excited the natural skeptic voice in our heads was calling out. we all three agreed that there was no way that it was a helicopter of any kind. this is based on the fact that we have lived in this location all of our lives and have seen "star - flight" and other helicopters at all hours at any angle etc. and there is always a sound, this made no sound. the flare idea was shot down as well, after we focused the object it clearly was not a flare, the only reason a flare was thought of was to perhaps explain its sudden appearance. it also did not pulsate or blink out like a flare, nor did it drop in elevation as a flare would. after what appeared to be stillness and no motion of the object and\or it's flight path, it's course seemed to be heading, albeit very slowly, in our general direction (roughly se as it was coming in from the nw), and once again it was lower on the horizon and in the sky than anything conventional. i am very familiar with planes appearing on the horizon and coming closer and closer and closer until it passes over. this was not the case it was to low on the horizon to be a plane, at least compared to any plane we have seen from this deck, also there was no sound. it was not some private plane; it (the light) appeared, continued to increase in brightness, then seemed to fly towards our direction, very slowly and with no sound (so it appeared), and then blinked out, to be clear -- it did not fade out, or slowly dim, it specifically "turned off." i consider myself to be somewhat (as well as my brother)an ametuar skywatcher; we have a celeston nexstar 130 slt and love gazing at the stars. our feelings were of amazement, nervousness, shock, realization, etc. we realized we saw an unidentified object in the sky, one that appeared to be cruising at a very low altitude and speed, with no sound. all of us are familiar with ufology especially what has recently been going on in texas. i am no expert, but if i were to classify this particular type of object, i (and my brother) agree it was somewhat triangular in shape and appeared to be bigger than a helicopter or small plane, but was not bigger than a commercial aircraft. basically the view through the binoculars was filled up with the object, the object and its lights seemed to fit fully within the viewing context (lens of the 8x42 bushnell excursion). as to its location, it was higher than the horizon on the other side of the lake by a few inches, that is to say if you are looking out at the horizon the object was roughly 1-3 inches higher than the green hills on the other side of the lake. we could also clearly tell it was not past the horizon, it appeared to be between us and the other side of the lake, our general consensus was that it was over the lake at the time of our viewing window.
